meanings.sent1: Her talent was unsurpassed by anyone in the competition.
meanings.sent2: The view from the mountaintop was unsurpassed in its beauty.
meanings.sent3: The cake's taste was unsurpassed, making everyone want seconds.
meanings.sent4: His dedication to his craft was unsurpassed, like a shining beacon of excellence.
meanings.sent5: The team's teamwork was unsurpassed, leading them to victory.

meanings.definition: To be better than anyone or anything else
meanings.sent1: She unsurpassed all her competitors in the race.
meanings.sent2: The new technology unsurpassed the old methods in efficiency.
meanings.sent3: The cat unsurpassed all others in catching mice, earning the title of 'Mouser of the Year'.
meanings.sent4: His determination unsurpassed all obstacles, propelling him to success.
meanings.sent5: The sun unsurpassed all other stars in brightness, lighting up the sky.
